 14686                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14687                                  
 14688                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14689                                  
 14690                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14691                                  ;
 14692                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 14693                                  ;
 14694                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 14695                                  ;							seg ffff )
 14696                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 14697                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 14698                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 14699                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 14700                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 14701                                  ;
 14702                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 14703                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 14704                                  ;
 14705                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14706                                  
 14707                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14708                                  HMAPtr:
 14709 0000140E 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14710                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 14711 00001413 8B3E[8C08]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14712                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14713 00001417 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14714 0000141A 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14715 0000141C 803E[9208]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 14716                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 14717 00001421 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14718 00001423 FF1E[8E08]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14719                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14720 00001427 8B3E[8C08]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14721                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14722                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 14723 0000142B C3                      		retn
 14724                                  
 14725                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14726                                  
 14727                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14728                                  
 14729                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 14730                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 14731                                  
 14732                                  move_sector:
 14733                                  
 14734                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 14735                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 14736                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 14737                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 14738                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 14739                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 14740                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 14741                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 14742                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 14743                                  ;
 14744                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 14745                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 14746                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 14747                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 14748                                  ; back to a byte move.
 14749                                  
 14750 0000142C FC                      		cld
 14751 0000142D 51                      		push	cx
 14752 0000142E B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 14753 00001431 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 14754 00001435 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14755 00001437 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 14756 0000143B 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14757 0000143D F3A5                    		rep movsw
 14758 0000143F 59                      		pop	cx
 14759 00001440 C3                      		retn
 14760                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14761                                  
 14762                                  movsec_bytes:				
 14763 00001441 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 14764 00001443 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 14765 00001445 59                      		pop	cx
 14766 00001446 C3                      		retn
 14767                                  
 14768                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14769                                  
 14770                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14771                                  
 14772                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 14773                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 14774                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 14775                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 14776                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 14777                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 14778                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 14779                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 14780                                  ;
 14781                                  ; input conditions:
 14782                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 14783                                  ;
 14784                                  ; output:
 14785                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 14786                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 14787                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 14788                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 14789                                  
 14790                                  check_wrap:	
 14791 00001447 50                      		push	ax
 14792 00001448 53                      		push	bx
 14793 00001449 06                      		push	es
 14794 0000144A 57                      		push	di
 14795 0000144B E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 14796 0000144E 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 14797                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14798 00001450 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14799                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14800 00001455 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 14801 00001457 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14802 0000145B 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 14803 0000145D 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 14804 00001460 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 14805 00001462 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 14806 00001464 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 14807                                  
 14808                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 14809                                  ; last sector on that track.
 14810                                  
 14811 00001466 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 14812 00001468 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 14813                                  		; 18/12/2022
 14814 0000146A 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 14815 0000146B 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 14816                                  					; if on	boundary
 14817                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 14818                                  not_on_bound:
 14819 0000146D 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 14820 00001470 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 14821 00001472 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 14822 00001474 40                      		inc	ax
 14823 00001475 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 14824 00001477 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 14825                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14826 0000147A 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14827 0000147E 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 14828                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14829                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 14830 00001480 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 14831 00001482 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 14832 00001483 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 14833                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14834 00001485 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 14835                                  
 14836                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 14837                                  
 14838 00001487 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 14839 00001489 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 14840 0000148B 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 14841                                  
 14842                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 14843                                  
 14844 0000148D 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 14845 0000148F 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 14846 00001491 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 14847                                  no_head_bound:				
 14848 00001492 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 14849 00001494 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 14850 00001495 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 14851 00001497 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 14852 00001499 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 14853 0000149B 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 14854 0000149E B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 14855 000014A0 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 14856 000014A2 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 14857 000014A4 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 14858 000014A6 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 14859 000014A8 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 14860 000014AA 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 14861 000014AC 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 14862                                  no_wrap:				
 14863 000014AE F8                      		clc
 14864 000014AF 5F                      		pop	di
 14865 000014B0 07                      		pop	es
 14866 000014B1 5B                      		pop	bx
 14867 000014B2 58                      		pop	ax
 14868 000014B3 C3                      		retn
 14869                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14870                                  
 14871                                  no_wrap_head:				
 14872 000014B4 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 14873 000014B6 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 14874 000014B8 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 14875                                  
 14876                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14877                                  
 14878                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14879                                  
 14880                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 14881                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 14882                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 14883                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 14884                                  ;
 14885                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 14886                                  
 14887                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14888                                  find_bds:	
 14889 000014BA C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 14890                                  fbds_1:					
 14891 000014BE 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14892 000014C2 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 14893 000014C4 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 14894                                  					; go to next bds
 14895 000014C7 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14896 000014CA 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 14897 000014CC F9                      		stc
 14898                                  fdbs_2:					
 14899 000014CD C3                      		retn
 14900                                  
 14901                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14902                                  
 14903                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14904                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14905                                  doint:
 14906                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14907 000014CE 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14908                                  					; get physical drive number
 14909                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 14910                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 14911                                  		
 14912 000014D1 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14913 000014D3 08C0                    		or	al, al
 14914 000014D5 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 14915                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14916 000014D7 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14917                                  					; get request code
 14918                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 14919 000014DA FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14920                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 14921 000014DD 9D                      		popf
 14922                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 14923                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14924 000014DE 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14925                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 14926                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14927 000014E3 9C                      		pushf
 14928                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14929 000014E4 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14930                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 14931                                  dointdone:				
 14932 000014E7 C3                      		retn
 14933                                  
 14934                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14935                                  
 14936                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14937                                  
 14938                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 14939                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 14940                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 14941                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 14942                                  ;
 14943                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 14944                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 14945                                  ;
 14946                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 14947                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 14948                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 14949                                  
 14950                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 14951                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 14952                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 14953                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 14954                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 14955                                  ;.olddx: resw
 14956                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 14957                                  ;.olddd: resd
 14958                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 14959                                  ;end struc
 14960                                  
 14961                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14962                                  
 14963                                  ;   entry conditions:
 14964                                  ;	ah = function
 14965                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 14966                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 14967                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 14968                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 14969                                  ;   output conditions:
 14970                                  ;	no dma violation.
 14971                                  
 14972                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 14973                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 14974                                  ;
 14975                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 14976                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 14977                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 14978                                  
 14979                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14980                                  
 14981                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14982                                  
 14983 000014E8 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 14984                                  
 14985                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14986                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14987                                  ; 09/12/2022
 14988                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 14989                                  
 14990                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14991                                  
 14992                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 14993                                  
 14994                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 14995                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 14996                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 14997                                  
 14998                                  format_special_stuff:
 14999 000014EC 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 15000 000014F1 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 15001 000014F3 53                      		push	bx
 15002 000014F4 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 15003 000014F7 E83D04                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 15004 000014FA 5B                      		pop	bx
 15005 000014FB EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 15006                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15007                                  
 15008                                  ; 16/10/2022
 15009                                  
 15010                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 15011                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 15012                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 15013                                  
 15014                                  		; 19/10/2022
 15015                                  ec35_special_stuff:
 15016 000014FD 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 15017 000014FF 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 15018 00001501 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 15019 00001502 51                      		push	cx
 15020 00001503 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 15021 00001505 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 15022 00001507 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 15023 00001509 8406[2005]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 15024 0000150D 59                      		pop	cx
 15025 0000150E 58                      		pop	ax
 15026 0000150F 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 15027                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 15028 00001511 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 15029 00001512 06                      		push	es
 15030                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15031 00001513 2EC41E[E814]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 15032                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 15033                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 15034 00001518 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 15035 0000151A 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 15036 0000151D 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 15037                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 15038                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 15039 00001521 07                      		pop	es
 15040 00001522 5B                      		pop	bx
 15041 00001523 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 15042                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15043                                  
 15044                                  ; 16/10/2022
 15045                                  
 15046                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 15047                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 15048                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 15049                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 15050                                  
 15051                                  ps2_special_stuff:
 15052 00001525 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 15053                                  					; read driver parm ?
 15054 0000152A 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 15055 0000152C 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 15056                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 15057 00001531 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 15058                                  ps2_30_problem:
 15059 00001533 50                      		push	ax
 15060 00001534 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 15061                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 15062                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15063 00001536 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15064                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 15065                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15066 0000153B 58                      		pop	ax
 15067 0000153C EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 15068                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15069                                  
 15070                                  ; 17/10/2022
 15071                                  ; 16/10/2022
 15072                                  
 15073                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 15074                                  
 15075                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 15076                                  
 15077                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 15078                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 15079                                  
 15080                                  		; 19/10/2022
 15081 0000153E 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 15082                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 15083                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 15084 0000153F 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 15085                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 15086                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 15087                                  
 15088                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 15089                                  
 15090 00001544 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 15091 00001547 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 15092 0000154A 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 15093                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 15094                                  format_special_stuff_done:		
 15095 0000154C 803E[2005]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 15096 00001551 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 15097                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 15098                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 15099                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h
 15100 00001553 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15101                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15102                                  		
 15103 00001558 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 15104                                  		
 15105 00001559 803E[2D06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 15106                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 15107 0000155E 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 15108                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 15109                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so
 15110 00001560 9D                      		popf
 15111 00001561 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 15112                                  ret_from_i13:
 15113 00001563 1F                      		pop	ds
 15114 00001564 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 15115                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15116                                  
 15117                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 15118                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 15119                                  ; a changeline error.
 15120                                  
 15121                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:
 15122 00001567 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 15123                                  i13_ret_error:				
 15124 00001569 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 15125 0000156C 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 15126 0000156E 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 15127 00001570 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 15128 00001572 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 15129 00001577 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 15130                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 15131                                  					; never	would
 15132 00001579 53                      		push	bx
 15133 0000157A BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 15134 0000157D E8B703                  		call	set_changed_dl
 15135 00001580 5B                      		pop	bx
 15136                                  int13b:
 15137 00001581 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 15138 00001582 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 15139                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15140                                  
 15141                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 15142                                  
 15143                                  goterr13:
 15144 00001584 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 15145 00001587 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 15146                                  goterr13_xxxx:
 15147 00001589 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 15148 0000158C 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 15149 0000158E 803E[2706]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 15150 00001593 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 15151                                  
 15152 00001595 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 15153                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 15154                                  					; (2 = romread)
 15155                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 15156 0000159A 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 15157                                  
 15158 0000159C 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 15159                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 15160                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15161 0000159E 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15162                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15163                                  					; call far 70:797h
 15164 000015A3 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 15165 000015A6 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 15166 000015A8 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 15167 000015AA 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 15168 000015AC 53                      		push	bx
 15169 000015AD 51                      		push	cx
 15170 000015AE 52                      		push	dx
 15171 000015AF A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 15172                                  loop_ecc:
 15173 000015B2 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 15174                                  
 15175                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 15176                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 15177                                  ;
 15178                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 15179                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 15180                                  ; track.
 15181                                  ;
 15182                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 15183                                  ; this request.
 15184                                  ;
 15185                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 15186                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 15187                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 15188                                  ;
 15189 000015B5 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 15190                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 15191                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15192 000015B8 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15193                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15194 000015BD 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 15195 000015BF 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 15196 000015C2 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 15197 000015C4 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 15198 000015C7 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 15199                                  		; 10/12/2022
 15200                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 15201                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 15202 000015C9 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 15203                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 15204                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 15205                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 15206                                  ok11_op:
 15207 000015CB FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 15208 000015CF 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 15209 000015D1 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 15210                                  					; add 200h to address
 15211 000015D3 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 15212 000015D5 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 15213 000015D7 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 15214                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15215                                  
 15216                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 15217                                  
 15218                                  ok11_exit_err:
 15219 000015D9 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 15220                                  ok11_exit:
 15221 000015DA 5A                      		pop	dx
 15222 000015DB 59                      		pop	cx
 15223 000015DC 5B                      		pop	bx
 15224 000015DD EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 15225                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15226                                  
 15227                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 15228                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 15229                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 15230                                  
 15231                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:
 15232 000015DF 06                      		push	es
 15233 000015E0 53                      		push	bx
 15234 000015E1 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 15235 000015E4 1E                      		push	ds
 15236 000015E5 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 15237 000015E6 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 15238                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 15239                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15240 000015E9 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15241                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15242 000015EE 5B                      		pop	bx
 15243 000015EF 07                      		pop	es
 15244 000015F0 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 15245 000015F2 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 15246 000015F5 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 15247                                  
 15248                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 15249                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 15250                                  
 15251                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:
 15252 000015F7 56                      		push	si
 15253 000015F8 57                      		push	di
 15254 000015F9 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 15255 000015FB BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 15256 000015FE E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 15257 00001601 5F                      		pop	di
 15258 00001602 5E                      		pop	si
 15259 00001603 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 15260                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15261                                  
 15262                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 15263                                  ; operation as best we can.
 15264                                  
 15265                                  gotdmaerr:
 15266 00001605 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 15267 00001608 FB                      		sti
 15268 00001609 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 15269 0000160C 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 15270                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 15271                                  					; functions we don't handle
 15272 0000160E 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 15273 00001611 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 15274 00001613 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 15275 00001616 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 15276 00001618 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 15277                                  
 15278                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 15279                                  
 15280                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 15281                                  
 15282 0000161A 52                      		push	dx
 15283 0000161B 51                      		push	cx
 15284 0000161C 53                      		push	bx
 15285 0000161D 50                      		push	ax
 15286 0000161E 55                      		push	bp
 15287 0000161F 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 15288 00001621 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 15289 00001623 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 15290 00001625 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 15291 00001627 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 15292 00001629 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 15293 0000162B 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 15294 0000162D 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 15295                                  
 15296                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 15297                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 15298                                  
 15299 00001631 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 15300 00001633 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 15301                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15302                                  
 15303                                  no_skip_first:
 15304 00001636 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 15305 00001638 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 15306 0000163A 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 15307                                  
 15308                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 15309                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 15310                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 15311                                  ;
 15312                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 15313                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 15314                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 15315                                  ; in error.
 15316                                  
 15317 0000163C 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 15318 0000163E 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 15319                                  
 15320                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 15321                                  
 15322 00001640 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 15323                                  					; set up head number
 15324 00001643 E888FE                  		call	doint
 15325 00001646 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 15326                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15327                                  
 15328                                  i13_done_dmaerr:
 15329 00001649 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 15330 0000164B F9                      		stc
 15331 0000164C E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 15332                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 15333                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15334                                  
 15335                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 15336                                  
 15337                                  intverify:
 15338 0000164F 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 15339 00001650 53                      		push	bx
 15340 00001651 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 15341 00001652 07                      		pop	es
 15342                                  dosimple:
 15343 00001653 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 15344                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 15345                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 15346                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15347 00001656 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15348                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15349 0000165B 5B                      		pop	bx
 15350 0000165C 07                      		pop	es
 15351 0000165D E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 15352                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15353                                  
 15354                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 15355                                  
 15356                                  intformat:
 15357 00001660 06                      		push	es
 15358 00001661 53                      		push	bx
 15359 00001662 56                      		push	si
 15360 00001663 57                      		push	di
 15361 00001664 1E                      		push	ds
 15362                                  
 15363                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 15364                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 15365                                  
 15366 00001665 06                      		push	es
 15367 00001666 1E                      		push	ds
 15368 00001667 07                      		pop	es
 15369 00001668 1F                      		pop	ds
 15370 00001669 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 15371 0000166B BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 15372 0000166E E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 15373 00001671 1F                      		pop	ds
 15374 00001672 5F                      		pop	di
 15375 00001673 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 15376 00001674 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 15377                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15378                                  
 15379                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 15380                                  ; the first block.
 15381                                  ;
 15382                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 15383                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 15384                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 15385                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 15386                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 15387                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 15388                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 15389                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 15390                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 15391                                  
 15392                                  doblock:
 15393                                  
 15394                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 15395                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 15396                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 15397                                  				
 15398 00001676 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15399                                  					; get head #, drive #
 15400 00001679 51                      		push	cx
 15401 0000167A 06                      		push	es
 15402 0000167B 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 15403                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 15404 0000167C E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 15405 0000167F 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 15406                                  		; 12/12/2022
 15407 00001683 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 15408                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 15409 00001688 5F                      		pop	di
 15410 00001689 07                      		pop	es
 15411 0000168A 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 15412 0000168C 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 15413 0000168E B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 15414 00001690 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 15415                                  doblockflop:
 15416 00001692 59                      		pop	cx
 15417                                  doblockcontinue:
 15418 00001693 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 15419 00001695 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 15420 00001697 50                      		push	ax
 15421 00001698 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 15422 0000169A EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 15423                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15424                                  
 15425                                  doblocklast:
 15426 0000169C 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 15427 0000169E 50                      		push	ax
 15428                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot
 15429 0000169F E82CFE                  		call	doint
 15430 000016A2 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 15431 000016A4 58                      		pop	ax
 15432 000016A5 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 15433                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 15434 000016A8 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 15435 000016AA 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 15436 000016AC 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 15437 000016AE 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 15438 000016B0 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 15439                                  					; then we are done already.
 15440 000016B2 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 15441                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 15442 000016B4 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 15443 000016B7 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 15444                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15445                                  
 15446                                  bufferx:
 15447 000016B9 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 15448                                  					; set up head number
 15449                                  buffer:
 15450 000016BC 53                      		push	bx
 15451 000016BD 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 15452 000016C0 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 15453 000016C3 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 15454                                  
 15455                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 15456                                  
 15457 000016C5 06                      		push	es
 15458 000016C6 1E                      		push	ds
 15459 000016C7 56                      		push	si
 15460 000016C8 57                      		push	di
 15461 000016C9 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 15462 000016CA 06                      		push	es
 15463 000016CB 1F                      		pop	ds
 15464 000016CC 07                      		pop	es
 15465 000016CD BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 15466 000016D0 57                      		push	di		; save it
 15467 000016D1 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 15468 000016D3 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 15469 000016D6 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 15470                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 15471 000016D7 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 15472 000016D8 5E                      		pop	si
 15473 000016D9 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 15474                                  
 15475                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 15476                                  
 15477 000016DA B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15478                                  					; get drive number
 15479 000016DC 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 15480 000016DF E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 15481                                  					;
 15482                                  					; ah is	function
 15483                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 15484                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 15485                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 15486                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 15487                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 15488 000016E2 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 15489 000016E5 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 15490 000016E6 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 15491 000016E8 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 15492                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15493                                  
 15494                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 15495                                  
 15496                                  doread:
 15497 000016EA 06                      		push	es
 15498 000016EB 53                      		push	bx
 15499 000016EC 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 15500 000016ED 07                      		pop	es
 15501 000016EE BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 15502 000016F1 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 15503 000016F3 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15504                                  					; get drive number
 15505 000016F6 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 15506                                  					; ah = function
 15507                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 15508                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 15509                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 15510 000016F9 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 15511 000016FC 5B                      		pop	bx
 15512 000016FD 07                      		pop	es
 15513 000016FE 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 15514 00001700 56                      		push	si
 15515 00001701 57                      		push	di
 15516 00001702 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 15517 00001704 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 15518 00001707 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 15519 0000170A 5F                      		pop	di
 15520 0000170B 5E                      		pop	si
 15521                                  
 15522                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 15523                                  
 15524                                  dotail:
 15525 0000170C 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 15526 0000170D 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 15527 00001710 41                      		inc	cx
 15528 00001711 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 15529 00001714 F8                      		clc
 15530 00001715 FEC8                    		dec	al
 15531 00001717 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 15532                                  
 15533                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 15534                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 15535                                  
 15536 00001719 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15537 0000171C E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 15538 0000171F E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 15539                                  
 15540                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 15541                                  
 15542                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 15543                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 15544                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 15545                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 15546                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 15547                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 15548                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 15549                                  
 15550                                  bad13:
 15551 00001722 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 15552 00001724 5D                      		pop	bp
 15553 00001725 5B                      		pop	bx
 15554 00001726 5B                      		pop	bx
 15555 00001727 59                      		pop	cx
 15556 00001728 5A                      		pop	dx
 15557 00001729 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 15558 0000172B E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 15559                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15560                                  
 15561                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:
 15562 0000172E E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 15563                                  
 15564                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15565                                  		; 10/12/2022
 15566                                  		;db 	0
 15567                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15568                                  
 15569                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 15570                                  
 15571                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 15572                                  
 15573                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15574                                  ; MSBIO2.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 15575                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15576                                  ; 17/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15577                                  
 15578                                  		; 19/10/2022
 15579                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 15580 00001731 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 15581 00001735 BF[7606]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 15582 00001738 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 15583 00001739 07                      		pop	es
 15584 0000173A E913EF                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 15585                                  
 15586                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 15587                                  
 15588                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15589                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 15590                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 15591                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 15592                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15593                                  
 15594                                  install_bds:
 15595 0000173D 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 15596 0000173E BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 15597                                  
 15598                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 15599                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 15600                                  loop_next_bds:
 15601 00001741 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 15602                                  					; fetch	next bds
 15603 00001743 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 15604 00001747 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 15605                                  					; drive	with new one?
 15606 0000174A 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 15607 0000174C B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 15608 0000174E 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 15609                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 15610 00001752 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 15611 00001755 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 15612                                  					; we don't own it
 15613 0000175A 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 15614                                  					; determine if changeline available
 15615 0000175D 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 15616 00001760 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 15617                                  next_bds:
 15618                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 15619 00001764 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 15620 00001767 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 15621                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 15622                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 15623 00001769 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 15624 0000176B 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 15625                                  					; install bds
 15626 0000176E 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 15627 00001770 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 15628                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 15629                                  					; set next pointer to null
 15630 00001773 1F                      		pop	ds
 15631                                  
 15632                                  ; 01/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:1785h)
 15633                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 15634                                  
 15635                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 15636                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 15637                                  
 15638                                  		; 01/06/2019
 15639 00001774 268A4534                		mov	al,[es:di+52]
 15640                                  		; 22/07/2023
 15641                                  		;mov	al,[es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 15642 00001778 3A06[2C01]              		cmp	al,[eot]
 15643 0000177C 7603                    		jbe	short _eot_ok
 15644 0000177E A2[2C01]                		mov	[eot],al
 15645                                  _eot_ok:
 15646 00001781 C3                      		retn
 15647                                  
 15648                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15649                                  
 15650                                  ; 17/10/2022
 15651                                  ;DRVLET	equ drvlet - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h
 15652                                  ;SNGMSG	equ sngmsg - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h	
 15653                                  ; 09/12/2022
 15654                                  DRVLET equ drvlet

 15733                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)

 15736                                  ; include msbio.cl2 (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)

 15743 000017C4 0D0A                    sngmsg:		db 0Dh,0Ah
 15744 000017C6 496E73657274206469-     		db 'Insert diskette for drive '
 15744 000017CF 736B6574746520666F-
 15744 000017D8 7220647269766520   
 15745                                  
 15746                                  		; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS offset 0070h:3D54h or 02C7h:17E4h
 15747 000017E0 413A20616E64207072-     drvlet:		db 'A: and press any key when ready',0Dh,0Ah
 15747 000017E9 65737320616E79206B-
 15747 000017F2 6579207768656E2072-
 15747 000017FB 656164790D0A       
 15748 00001801 0A00                    		db 0Ah,0

 15750                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 15751                                  
 15752                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15753                                  ; input : es:di points to current bds for drive.
 15754                                  ; return : zero set if no open files
 15755                                  ;	   zero reset if open files
