 16897                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16898                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 16899                                  
 16900                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 16901                                  
 16902                                  struc buffinfo
 16903 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1	; Pointer to next buffer in list
 16904 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1	; Pointer to previous buffer in list
 16905 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1	; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 16906                                  			; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 16907                                  			; = FFh if buffer free
 16908 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1	; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 16909                                  			;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 16910                                  			; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 16911                                  			; Bit 5 = Reserved
 16912                                  			; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 16913                                  			; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 16914                                  			; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 16915                                  			; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 16916                                  			; Bit 0 = Reserved
 16917 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1	; Sector number of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 16918                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (bit 7 = 0)
 16919 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1	; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 16920 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1	; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 16921 0000000D ????????                .buf_DPB :	resd 1	; Pointer to drive parameters
 16922 00000011 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1	; How full buffer is (bit 7 = 1)
 16923 00000013 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1	; make DWORD boundary for 386
 16924                                  .size:
 16925                                  endstruc
 16926                                  
 16927                                  %define buf_offset	dword [buf_sector]
 16928                                  			;For bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 16929                                  			;offset of the start of the buffer in
 16930                                  			;the file pointed to by buf_ID.  Thus
 16931                                  			;the buffer starts at location
 16932                                  			;buf_offset in the file and contains
 16933                                  			;buf_fill bytes.
 16934                                  
 16935                                  bufinsiz	equ	buffinfo.size ; ; Size of structure in bytes
 16936                                  
 16937                                  
 16938                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 16939

 16941                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 16942                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B

 16944                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 16945                                  ;***
 16946                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 16947                                  
 16948                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 16949                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 16950                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B
 16951                                  buf_type_0	EQU	11110001B	; AND sets type to "none"
 16952

 16957                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16958                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 16959                                  
 16960                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 16961                                  
 16962                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 16963                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 16964                                  ;
 16965                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 16966                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 16967                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 16968                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 16969                                  ;
 16970                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 16971                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 16972                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 16973                                  
 16974                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 16975                                  
 16976                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16977                                  
 16978                                  struc	DPB
 16979 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 16980 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 16981 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 16982 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 16983 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 16984 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 16985 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 16986 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 16987 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 16988 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 16989                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 16990 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 16991 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 16992 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 16993 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 16994 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 16995                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 16996 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 16997 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 16998 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 16999                                  .size:
 17000                                  endstruc
 17001                                  
 17002                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 17003                                  
 17004                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)

 17061                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 17062                                  
 17063                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 17064                                  ;
 17065                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 17066                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 17067                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 17068                                  ;
 17069                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 17070                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 17071                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 17072                                  ;
 17073                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 17074                                  
 17075                                  struc A_BPB
 17076 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 17077 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 17078 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 17079 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 17080 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 17081 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1

 17354                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17355                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 17356                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17357                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 17358                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 17359                                  									  
 17360                                  ;*******************************					  
 17361                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 17362                                  ;*******************************					  
 17363                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 17364                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 17365                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 17366                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 17367                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 17368                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 17369                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 17370                                  ;For all others:							  
 17371                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 17372                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 17373                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 17374                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 17375                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 17376                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 17377                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 17378                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 17379                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 17380                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 17381                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 17382                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 17383                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 17384                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 17385                                  ;									  
 17386                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 17387                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 17388                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 17389                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 17390                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 17391                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 17392                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 17393                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 17394                                  ;									  
 17395                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 17396                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 17397                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 17398                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 17399                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 17400                                  ;									  
 17401                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 17402                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 17403                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 17404                                  ;									  
 17405                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 17406                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 17407                                  ;									  
 17408                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 17409                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 17410                                  ;									  
 17411                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 17412                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 17413                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 17414                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 17415                                  ;						called. 		  
 17416                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 17417                                  ;									  
 17418                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 17419                                  ;									  
 17420                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 17421                                  ;									  
 17422                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 17423                                  ;									  
 17424                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 17425                                  ;									  
 17426                                  
 17427                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 17428                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 17429 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 17430 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 17431                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 17432 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 17433 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 17434 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1					  
 17435 00000006 ????????                			resb 4					  
 17436                                  endstruc					  
 17437

 17439                                  DMAchannel3		equ 10000000b					  
 17440                                  ScndIntController	equ 01000000b					  
 17441                                  RealTimeClock		equ 00100000b					  
 17442                                  KeyEscapeSeq		equ 00010000b					  
 17443                                  					;;End of Modification

 17545                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17546                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 17547                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17548                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17549                                  
 17550                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 17551                                  ;
 17552                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 17553                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 17554                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 17555                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 17556                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 17557                                  ;
 17558                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 17559                                  ;
 17560                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 17561                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 17562                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 17563                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 17564                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 17565                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 17566                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 17567                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 17568                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 17569                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 17570                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 17571                                  
 17572                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 17573                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 17574                                  
 17575                                  struc 		curdir_list
 17576                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 17577 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 17578 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 17579 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 17580 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 17581 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 17582 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 17583                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 17584 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 17585 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 17586 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 17587                                  .size:
 17588                                  endstruc
 17589                                  
 17590                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 17591                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 17592                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 17593                                  						; argument
 17594                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 17595                                  
 17596                                  ;**	Flag values for CURDIR_FLAGS
 17597                                  
 17598                                  ;Flag word masks
 17599                                  curdir_isnet	EQU	1000000000000000B
 17600                                  curdir_isifs	EQU	1000000000000000B
 17601                                  curdir_inuse	EQU	0100000000000000B
 17602                                  curdir_splice	EQU	0010000000000000B
 17603                                  curdir_local	EQU	0001000000000000B

 17606                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991)

 17609                                  
 17610                                  ; system file table
 17611                                  
 17612                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 17613                                  ;
 17614                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 17615                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 17616                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 17617                                  
 17618                                  struc	SF
 17619 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 17620 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 17621 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 17622                                  .size:
 17623                                  endstruc
 17624                                  
 17625                                  ;**	System file table entry
 17626                                  ;
 17627                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 17628                                  
 17629                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 17630 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 17631                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 17632 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 17633 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 17634 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 17635                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 17636                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 17637                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 17638                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 17639                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 17640                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 17641                                  					;   (WRITE)
 17642                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 17643                                  					;
 17644                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 17645                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 17646                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 17647                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 17648                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 17649                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 17650                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 17651                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 17652                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 17653                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 17654                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 17655                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 17656 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 17657                                  					; to device header if local device,
 17658                                  					; points to net device header if
 17659                                  					; remote
 17660 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 17661                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 17662 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 17663 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 17664 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 17665 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 17666                                  ;
 17667                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 17668                                  ; ID
 17669                                  ;
 17670 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 17671 0000001B ????                    .sf_dirsec:	resw	1		; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 17672 0000001D ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above
 17673                                  ;
 17674                                  ; End of 7 bytes of file-system specific info.
 17675                                  ;
 17676 0000001E <res Bh>                .sf_name:	resb	11		; 11 character name that is in the
 17677                                  					; directory entry.  This is used by
 17678                                  					; close to detect file deleted and
 17679                                  					; disk changed errors.
 17680                                  ; SHARING INFO
 17681 00000029 ????????                .sf_chain:	resd	1		; link to next SF
 17682 0000002D ????                    .sf_UID:	resw	1
 17683 0000002F ????                    .sf_PID:	resw	1
 17684 00000031 ????                    .sf_MFT:	resw	1
 17685 00000033 ????                    .sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *		; Last cluster accessed
 17686 00000035 ????????                .sf_IFS_HDR:	resd 	1 ; **
 17687                                  .size:
 17688                                  endstruc

 17967                                  ; 05/07/2018
 17968                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17969                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 17970                                  
 17971                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17972                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 17973                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17974                                  
 17975                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 17976                                  ;
 17977                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 17978                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 17979                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 17980                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 17981                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 17982                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 17983                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 17984                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 17985                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 17986                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 17987                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 17988                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 17989                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 17990                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 17991                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 17992                                  ;
 17993                                  
 17994                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 17995                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 17996                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 17997                                  ;
 17998                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 17999                                  ;
 18000                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 18001                                  ;
 18002                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 18003                                  ;
 18004                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 18005                                  ;
 18006                                  
 18007                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 18008                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 18009                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 18010                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 18011                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 18012                                  ;      deeply nested one
 18013                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 18014                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 18015                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 18016                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 18017                                  
 18018                                  		;EVEN
 18019                                  ;align 2
 18020                                  		; 21/10/2022
 18021                                  
 18022 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 18023 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 18024 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 18025 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 18026 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 18027 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 18028                                  
 18029 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 18030 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 18031 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 18032                                  
 18033                                  ;***********************************************************************
 18034                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 18035                                  
 18036                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18037                                  
 18038 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 18039                                  
 18040                                  int02:
 18041                                  
 18042                                  ; *********************************************************************
 18043                                  ;
 18044                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 18045                                  ;
 18046                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 18047                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 18048                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 18049                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 18050                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 18051                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 18052                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 18053                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 18054                                  ;
 18055                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 18056                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 18057                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 18058                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 18059                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 18060                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 18061                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 18062                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 18063                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 18064                                  ;
 18065                                  ; *********************************************************************
 18066                                  
 18067 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 18068 00000017 06                      	push	es
 18069 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 18070 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18071                                  	; 02/11/2022
 18072 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 18073 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 18074 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 18075                                  
 18076 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 18077                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 18078                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 18079                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 18080                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 18081 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 18082 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 18083                                  special02:
 18084 0000002C 58                      	pop	ax
 18085 0000002D 2EFF2E[1200]            	jmp	far [cs:old02]
 18086                                  normal02:
 18087 00000032 58                      	pop	ax
 18088 00000033 E81101                  	call	do_int_stacks
 18089 00000036 [1200]                  	dw	old02
 18090

 18317                                  ;********************************************************************
 18318                                  ;common routines
 18319                                  ;********************************************************************
 18320                                  
 18321                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 18322                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 18323                                  ; service routine
 18324                                  
 18325                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 18326                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18327                                  
 18328                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 18329                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 18330                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 18331                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 18332                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 18333                                  
 18334                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 18335                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:0147h)
 18336                                  
 18337                                  do_int_stacks:
 18338 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 18339 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 18340 00000149 06                      	push	es
 18341 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 18342 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 18343 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 18344                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18345                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 18346                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18347 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 18348 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 18349 0000015C 7551                    	jne	short notfree02
 18350                                  
 18351 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 18352                                  
 18353                                  found02:
 18354 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 18355 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 18356                                  
 18357 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 18358                                  
 18359 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 18360                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18361                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 18362                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18363                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 18364 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 18365 00000176 7544                    	jne	short foundbad02
 18366                                  
 18367                                  	; 02/07/2023 (MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT code)
 18368 00000178 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 18369 0000017A 8EC5                    	mov	es,bp
 18370 0000017C 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 18371 0000017E 8B6E06                  	mov	bp,[bp+6]
 18372 00000181 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 18373 00000183 8CC4                    	mov	sp,es
 18374 00000185 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18375 00000187 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 18376                                  
 18377                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT code)
 18378                                  	;push    bp
 18379                                  	;mov     bp,sp
 18380                                  	;mov     ax,[bp+8]
 18381                                  	;pop     bp
 18382                                  	;push    es
 18383                                  	;pop     ss
 18384                                  	;mov     sp,bp
 18385                                  	;mov     bp,ax
 18386                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18387                                  	;;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 18388                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 18389                                  
 18390 0000018B 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 18391                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18392 0000018C 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 18393                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18394                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 18395                                  
 18396 00000190 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 18397                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18398 00000192 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 18399                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18400                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 18401 00000196 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 18402 0000019A 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 18403                                  
 18404                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18405                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 18406                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18407 0000019E 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 18408 000001A3 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 18409                                  
 18410 000001A8 07                      	pop	es
 18411 000001A9 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 18412 000001AA 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry
 18413 000001AB 83C402                  	add	sp,2
 18414 000001AE CF                      	iret				; done with this interrupt
 18415                                  
 18416                                  notfree02:
 18417 000001AF 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; error flag
 18418 000001B1 7404                    	je	short findnext02	;  no, continue
 18419                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18420                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, restore error value
 18421                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18422 000001B3 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 18423                                  
 18424                                  findnext02:
 18425 000001B7 E81200                  	call	longpath
 18426 000001BA EBA8                    	jmp	short found02
 18427                                  
 18428                                  foundbad02:
 18429 000001BC 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 18430 000001C1 72F4                    	jc	short findnext02
 18431 000001C3 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; flag this entry
 18432                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18433                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],clobbered
 18434                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18435 000001C5 26C6460003              	mov	byte [es:bp],clobbered ; 3
 18436 000001CA EBEB                    	jmp	short findnext02	; keep looking
 18437                                  
 18438                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18439                                  
 18440                                  ; Common routines
 18441                                  
 18442                                  longpath:
 18443                                  	; 21/03/2019
 18444 000001CC 2E8B2E[0E00]            	mov	bp,[cs:lastentry]	; start with last entry in table
 18445                                  lploopp:
 18446                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18447                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; is entry free?
 18448                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18449 000001D1 26807E0000              	cmp	byte [es:bp],free
 18450 000001D6 7512                    	jne	short inuse		;  no, try next one
 18451                                  
 18452 000001D8 B001                    	mov	al,allocated
 18453                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18454                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	; allocate entry
 18455                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18456 000001DA 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 18457 000001DE 3C00                    	cmp	al,free 		; is it still free?
 18458 000001E0 7414                    	je	short found		;  yes, go use it
 18459                                  
 18460 000001E2 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; is it other than Allocated or Free?
 18461 000001E4 7404                    	je	short inuse		;  no, check the next one
 18462                                  
 18463                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18464                                  	;mov	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, put back the error state
 18465                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18466 000001E6 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al
 18467                                  inuse:
 18468 000001EA 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 18469 000001EF 7406                    	je	short fatal
 18470 000001F1 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize
 18471 000001F4 EBDB                    	jmp	short lploopp
 18472                                  found:
 18473 000001F6 C3                      	retn
 18474                                  fatal:
 18475 000001F7 1E                      	push	ds
 18476 000001F8 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 18477 000001FB 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 18478 000001FD 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 18479 00000202 1F                      	pop	ds
 18480 00000203 7504                    	jne	short skip_nmis
 18481                                  
 18482 00000205 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable pc convertible nmis
 18483 00000207 E672                    	out	72h,al
 18484                                  
 18485                                  skip_nmis:
 18486 00000209 FA                      	cli				; disable and mask
 18487 0000020A B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh			;   all other ints
 18488 0000020C E621                    	out	021h,al
 18489 0000020E E6A1                    	out	0A1h,al
 18490                                  
 18491 00000210 8CCE                    	mov	si,cs
 18492 00000212 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 18493 00000214 BE[3B02]                	mov	si,fatal_msg
 18494                                  ;SR;
 18495                                  ;   We set all foci to this VM to issue the stack failure message
 18496                                  ;
 18497 00000217 50                      	push	ax
 18498 00000218 1E                      	push	ds
 18499                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 18500                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 18501                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18502 00000219 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 18503 0000021C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 18504                                  
 18505                                  	;test	byte [08D0h],1 	; (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:021Eh)
 18506 0000021E F606[6608]01            	test	byte [IsWin386],1 ; (retrodos4.sys, offset: ****h)
 18507 00000223 1F                      	pop	ds
 18508 00000224 58                      	pop	ax
 18509 00000225 7405                    	jz	short fatal_loop	; win386 not present, continue
 18510                                  
 18511                                  	;;call	far ptr 0070h:08D1h ; (MSDOS 621, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:0227h)
 18512                                  	;call	KERNEL_SEGMENT:V86_Crit_SetFocus ; set focus to this VM
 18513                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18514 00000227 9A[6708]7000            	call	DOSBIODATASEG:V86_Crit_SetFocus ; 0070h:08D1h
 18515                                  ;
 18516                                  ;SR; We do not bother about the returned status of this call. 
 18517                                  ;
 18518                                  fatal_loop:
 18519 0000022C AC                      	lodsb
 18520 0000022D 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'
 18521 0000022F 7408                    	je	short fatal_done
 18522                                  
 18523 00000231 B307                    	mov	bl,7

 18971                                  ;;
 18972                                  ;;	cas -- a) if we got our memory size from the ROM, we should test it
 18973                                  ;;		  before we try to run.
 18974                                  ;;	       b) in any case, we should check for sufficient memory and give
 18975                                  ;;		  an appropriate error diagnostic if there isn't enough
 18976                                  ;
 18977                                  ;	push	cs
 18978                                  ;	pop	ds
 18979                                  ;
 18980                                  ;;	cas note:  It would be better to put dos + bios_code BELOW sysinit
 18981                                  ;;	  that way it would be easier to slide them down home in a minimal
 18982                                  ;;	  memory system after sysinit.  As it is, you need room to keep
 18983                                  ;;	  two full non-overlapping copies, since sysinit sits between the
 18984                                  ;;	  temporary home and the final one.  the problem with doing that
 18985                                  ;;	  is that sys*.asm are filled with "mov ax,cs, sub ax,11h" type stuff.

 18988                                  ;					; in case of UMBs

 19783                                  
 19784                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 19785                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 19786                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 19787                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 19788                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 19789                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 19790                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 19791                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 19792                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 19793                                  ;
 19794                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 19795                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 19796                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 19797                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 19798                                  ; been patched.
 19799                                  
 19800                                  	; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19801                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:0749h)

 20114                                  ;   Once we get to this point, the above code, which is below "retry"

 20116                                  ;   which follow....)

 20118                                  retry:
 20119 00000773 BA[9B45]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 20120                                  
 20121                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 20122                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 20123                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 20124                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 20125                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 20126                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 20127                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 20128                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 20129                                  
 20130                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 20131                                  
 20132 00000776 52                      	push	dx		; save pointer to name
 20133 00000777 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 20134 0000077A B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 20135 0000077C CD21                            int     21h             ; get biggest piece
 20136 0000077E B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 20137 00000780 CD21                    	int	21h		; second time gets it
 20138 00000782 726B                    	jc	short memerrjx	; oooops
 20139                                  
 20140 00000784 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20141 00000786 B449                    	mov	ah,49h	; DEALLOC
 20142 00000788 CD21                    	int	21h		; give it right back
 20143 0000078A 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 20144                                  
 20145                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 20146                                  
 20147                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 20148                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 20149                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 20150                                  
 20151                                  	; 22/10/2022
 20152                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)
 20153 0000078C 8B1E[9402]                      mov     bx,[MEMORY_SIZE] ; get location of end of memory
 20154 00000790 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 20155                                  
 20156                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 20157                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 20158                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 20159                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 20160                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 20161                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 20162                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 20163                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 20164                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 20165                                  ;
 20166                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 20167                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 20168                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 20169                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 20170                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 20171                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 20172                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP
 20173                                  
 20174                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 20175                                  	; (SYSINIT:0858h)

 21015                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 21016                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 21017                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 21018                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 21019                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 21020                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 21021                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 21022                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 21023                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 21024                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 21025                                  ;	  stub will go.
 21026                                  ;
 21027                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 21028                                  
 21029                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21030                                  update_arena:
 21031 00000A0A 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 21032 00000A0B 57                      	push	di
 21033 00000A0C 51                      	push	cx
 21034 00000A0D 52                      	push	dx
 21035                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21036                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 21037                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21038                                  	; ds = cs 
 21039 00000A0E C53E[6D02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 21040 00000A12 4F                      	dec	di
 21041 00000A13 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 21042                                  						;  before sysvar
 21043 00000A14 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 21044                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 21045 00000A16 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 21046 00000A1B 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 21047 00000A1D 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 21048                                  
 21049                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 21050 00000A1F 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 21051 00000A24 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 21052 00000A26 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 21053 00000A28 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 21054 00000A2A 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21055                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 21056 00000A2C 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 21057                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 21058 00000A30 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 21059 00000A36 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 21060                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 21061 00000A38 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 21062 00000A3C 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 21063                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21064                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 21065 00000A3E 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 21066 00000A41 5A                      	pop	dx
 21067 00000A42 59                      	pop	cx
 21068 00000A43 5F                      	pop	di
 21069 00000A44 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 21070 00000A45 C3                      	retn
 21071                                  ;
 21072                                  ; M012 : END
 21073                                  ;

 21092                                  ;
 21093                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 21094                                  ;
 21095                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 21096                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 21097                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 21098                                  ;
 21099                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 21100                                  ;
 21101                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21102                                  
 21103                                  AllocHMA:
 21104                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 21105                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 21106                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 21107                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 21108                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 21109                                  
 21110                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 21111                                  ;
 21112                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 21113                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 21114                                  ;	push	ax
 21115                                  ;	popf
 21116                                  ;	pushf
 21117                                  ;	pop	ax
 21118                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 21119                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 21120                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 21121                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 21122                                  
 21123                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 21124                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 21125                                  
 21126 00000A52 1E                      	push	ds
 21127                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 21128                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 21129                                  	; 21/10/2022

 21131 00000A56 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21132

 21134 00000A5B 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 21135

 21137 00000A60 CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 21138                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 21139                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 21140                                  
 21141 00000A62 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 21142                                  	;mov	[0Eh], bx
 21143 00000A66 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 21144                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 21145                                  
 21146 00000A6A B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 21147 00000A6C BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 21148                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 21149 00000A6F FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 21150 00000A73 48                      	dec	ax
 21151 00000A74 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA
 21152                                  
 21153                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 21154                                  
 21155 00000A76 B488                    	mov	ah,88h

 21159                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K

 21161                                  	;jb	short grabhma_error

 21169 00000A86 751A                    	jnz	short grabhma_error ; error if couldn't enable A20
 21170                                  
 21171 00000A88 E88501                  	call	IsVDiskInstalled
 21172 00000A8B 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA
 21173

 21260 00000AC9 CB                      	retf
 21261                                  
 21262                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21263                                  ;
 21264                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 21265                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 21266                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 21267                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 21268                                  ;
 21269                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 21270                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 21271                                  ;
 21272                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21273                                  
 21274                                  StartVDHead:
 21275                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 21276                                  
 21277 00000ACA 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 21278 00000ACE 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 21279 00000AD0 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 21280 00000AD2 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 21281 00000AD4 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 21282                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 21283 00000AD5 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 21284                                  VDiskSig1:
 21285 00000ADC 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 21286                                  
 21287                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 21288                                  
 21289 00000AE1 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 21290                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 21291 00000AE7 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 21292 00000AF6 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 21293 00000AF8 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 21294                                  VDInt19:
 21295 00000AF9 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 21296                                  OldVDInt19:
 21297 00000AFA 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 21298                                  
 21299                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 21300                                  
 21301                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 21302 00000AFE 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 21303                                  VDiskSig2:
 21304 00000B01 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 21305                                  
 21306                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 21307                                  
 21308 00000B06 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 21309 00000B09 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 21310 00000B0B 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 21311 00000B0C 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 21312 00000B0E 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 21313 00000B0F 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 21314 00000B11 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 21315 00000B13 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 21316 00000B14 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 21317 00000B16 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 21318 00000B18 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 21319 00000B1A 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 21320 00000B1C 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 21321                                  
 21322                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 21323                                  
 21324                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21325                                  ;
 21326                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 21327                                  ;
 21328                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 21329                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 21330                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 21331                                  ;
 21332                                  ; Inputs : None
 21333                                  ;
 21334                                  ; Outputs : None
 21335                                  ;
 21336                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 21337                                  ;
 21338                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21339                                  
 21340                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 21341                                  
 21342                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 21343 00000B1E 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21344 00000B20 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 21345                                  
 21346                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 21347                                  
 21348                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21349 00000B22 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 21350                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 21351 00000B25 2EA3[FA0A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 21352 00000B29 A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 21353                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 21354 00000B2C 2EA3[FC0A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 21355                                  
 21356                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 21357                                  
 21358 00000B30 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 21359                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4

 21419                                  ; procedure : ClrVDISKHeader
 21420                                  ;
 21421                                  ;		Clears the first 32 bytes at 1MB boundary

 21423                                  ;		left by previous DOS=HIGH session

 21427                                  struc desc
 21428 00000000 ????                     .seg_lim:	resw	1		; seg limit 64K 
 21429 00000002 ????                     .lo_word:	resw	1		; 24 bit seg physical 
 21430 00000004 ??                       .hi_byte:	resb 	1		; address
 21431 00000005 ??                       .acc_rights:	resb	1		; access rights ( CPL0 - R/W )
 21432 00000006 ????                     .reserved:	resw	1		;
 21433                                   .size:

 21462                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIT1.ASM)

 21465                                  ; (SYSINIT:0CA6h)
 21466                                  
 21467                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 21468                                  
 21469                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 21470                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 21471                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 21472                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 21473                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 21474                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 21475                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 21476                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 21477                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 21478                                  ;								      ;I070
 21479                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 21480                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 21481                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 21482                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 21483                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 21484                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 21485                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 21486                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 21487                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 21488                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 21489                                  ;								      ;I070
 21490                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 21491                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 21492                                  
 21493                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21494                                  	; ds = cs
 21495                                  
 21496                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 21497                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 21498

 21501 00000BC9 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 21502 00000BCB B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 21503 00000BCD D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 21504 00000BCF B104                    	mov	cl,4
 21505 00000BD1 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl

 22558                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 22559                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 22560                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 22561                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 22562                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 22563                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 22564                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 22565                                  ;
 22566                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 22567                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 22568                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 22569                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 22570                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 22571                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 22572                                  ;
 22573                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 22574                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 22575                                  ;
 22576                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 22577                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 22578                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 22579                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 22580                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 22581                                  ;
 22582                                  ;	for round-up machine
 22583                                  ;
 22584                                  ;			  none.
 22585                                  
 22586                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 22587                                  ;
 22588                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 22589                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 22590                                  
 22591                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22592

 22797                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22798                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 22799                                  ;
 22800                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 22801                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 22802                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 22803                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 22804                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 22805                                  ; program).

 22810
