 22816                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 22817                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 22818                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 22819                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 22820                                  ; carridge return.

 22823                                  ;character after =.

 22968                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 22969                                  ;
 22970                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 22971                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 22972                                  ;
 22973                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 22974                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 22975                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 22976                                  
 22977                                  ParaRound:
 22978 0000113B 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 22979 0000113E D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 22980 00001140 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22981 00001142 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22982 00001144 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22983 00001146 C3                      	retn

 22985                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22986                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 22987                                  ;
 22988                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 22989                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 22990                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 22991                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 22992                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 22993                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 22994                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 22995                                  ;
 22996                                  ;in: after relocation,
 22997                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 22998                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 22999                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 23000                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 23001                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 23002                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 23003                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 23004                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 23005                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 23006                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 23007                                  ;
 23008                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 23009                                  
 23010                                  	; 24/10/2022
 23011                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 23012                                  sysinit_base:				
 23013 00001147 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 23014 0000114C 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 23015 00001151 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 23016 00001153 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 23017 00001158 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 23018 0000115D 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 23019 0000115E 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 23020 0000115F 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 23021                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 23022                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 23023 00001161 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 23024 00001164 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 23025 00001169 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 23026                                  
 23027                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 23028                                  
 23029 0000116B B409                    	mov	ah,9
 23030 0000116D 0E                      	push	cs
 23031 0000116E 1F                      	pop	ds
 23032                                  	; 30/12/2022
 23033                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 23034                                  	;mov	dx, 102
 23035 0000116F BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 23036                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 23037 00001172 CD21                    	int	21h
 23038                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 23039                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 23040                                  
 23041                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 23042                                  stall:
 23043                                  	; 24/10/2022
 23044                                  _stall: 
 23045                                  	; 11/12/2022
 23046 00001174 F4                      	hlt 
 23047                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 23048                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 23049 00001175 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 23050                                  
 23051                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 23052 00001177 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 23053                                  
 23054                                  ;-------------------------------------
 23055                                  
 23056                                  sum_up:
 23057                                  
 23058                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 23059                                  ;out:  ax - result
 23060                                  ;
 23061                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 23062                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 23063                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 23064                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 23065                                  ;
 23066                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 23067                                  
 23068 0000117C 1E                      	push	ds
 23069                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 23070                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 23071 0000117D 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 23072                                  	; 24/10/2022
 23073                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 23074 00001181 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 23075 00001183 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 23076 00001185 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 23077 00001187 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 23078                                  					; whole test better fail.
 23079 0000118C D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 23080 0000118E 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 23081                                  sum1:
 23082 00001190 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 23083 00001192 46                      	inc	si
 23084 00001193 46                      	inc	si
 23085 00001194 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 23086                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 23087                                  sum_sys_code:
 23088                                  	; 24/10/2022
 23089 00001196 BE9611                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23090                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23091                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 23092                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 23093                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 23094                                  	; 02/11/2022
 23095                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 23096                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 23097 00001199 B9[604D]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 23098 0000119C 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 23099 0000119E D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 23100                                  sum2:
 23101 000011A0 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 23102 000011A3 46                      	inc	si
 23103 000011A4 46                      	inc	si

 23106 000011A8 C3                      	retn

 23108                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23109                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)

 23111                                  
 23112                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)

 23131                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23132                                  ; Set_Buffer
 23133                                  ;
 23134                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 23135                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 23136                                  ;
 23137                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 23138                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 23139                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 23140                                  ;
 23141                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 23142                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 23143                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23144                                  
 23145                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23146                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 23147                                  
 23148                                  set_buffer:
 23149 000011C8 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 23150 000011CA E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 23151 000011CD 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 23152                                  	;mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 23153                                  	; 17/09/2023
 23154 000011CF FEC2                    	inc	dl ; mov dl,1
 23155                                  set_buff_1:
 23156                                  	; 25/10/2022
 23157                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 23158 000011D1 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 23159                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 23160 000011D3 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 23161                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 23162 000011D6 C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 23163                                  
 23164 000011DB 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 23165 000011DD 2E8B0E[9902]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 23166 000011E2 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 23167                                  
 23168                                  ;	for each buffer
 23169                                  
 23170                                  nxt_buff:
 23171 000011E3 E86100                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 23172 000011E6 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 23173 000011E8 E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 23174                                  
 23175 000011EA 2E2B3E[9D02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 23176                                  
 23177 000011EF 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 23178                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 23179 000011F0 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 23180 000011F3 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 23181                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 23182                                  	; 25/10/2022
 23183 000011F5 26894D02                	mov	[es:di+2],cx
 23184                                  
 23185 000011F9 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMA ?
 23186 000011FB 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 23187                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 23188 000011FD C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 23189 00001201 2EA1[6403]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 23190                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0
 23191 00001205 C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 23192                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 23193 0000120A 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 23194 0000120D 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 23195                                  	;; 05/09/2023
 23196                                  	;;sub	ax,24 ; bufinsiz		; (bufinsiz is 24 in PCDOS 7.1)
 23197 00001211 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 23198                                  set_buff_2:
 23199 00001214 2E0106[6203]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 23200                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2
 23201 00001219 2E800E[AD14]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2
 23202                                  	;call	round
 23203                                  	;retn
 23204                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23205 0000121F E93D30                  	jmp	round
 23206                                  
 23207                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23208                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 23209                                  ;
 23210                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 23211                                  ;
 23212                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 23213                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 23214                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23215                                  
 23216                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 23217                                  GetBufferAddr:
 23218 00001222 53                      	push	bx
 23219 00001223 52                      	push	dx
 23220 00001224 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 23221 00001228 2EF726[9902]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 23222                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 23223 0000122D 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 23224                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 23225                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 23226                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23227 00001230 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 23228 00001232 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 23229 00001234 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 23230                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 23231 00001237 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 23232 00001239 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 23233 0000123C 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 23234                                  	
 23235                                  	;mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 23236                                  	; 05/09/2023
 23237                                  	; zf=1
 23238 0000123E 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 23239                                  	; zf=1
 23240                                  	
 23241                                  	;zf=1
 23242                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 23243                                  	;zf=1
 23244 0000123F 2E8E06[6403]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 23245                                  got_hma:
 23246 00001244 5A                      	pop	dx
 23247 00001245 5B                      	pop	bx
 23248 00001246 C3                      	retn
 23249

 23251                                  
 23252                                  set_buffer_info:
 23253                                  
 23254                                  ;function: set buf_link,buf_id,buf_sector
 23255                                  ;
 23256                                  ;in: es:di -> buffer header to be set.
 23257                                  ;    ax = di
 23258                                  ;
 23259                                  ;out:
 23260                                  ;    above entries set.
 23261                                  
 23262                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 23263 00001247 2EFF36[BD02]            	push	word [cs:buf_prev_off]
 23264                                  	;pop	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev]
 23265 0000124C 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 23266 00001250 2EA3[BD02]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 23267 00001254 2E0306[9D02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	;adjust ax
 23268                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 23269 00001259 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 23270                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_ID],00FFh  ; new buffer free
 23271 0000125C 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 23272                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 23273 00001262 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 23274                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 23275 00001268 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 23276 0000126E C3                      	retn
 23277                                  
 23278                                  ; ======================================================================
 23279                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 23280                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23281                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23282                                  
 23283                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23284                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 23285                                  ;
 23286                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 23287                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 23288                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 23289                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 23290                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 23291                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 23292                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 23293                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 23294                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 23295                                  ;
 23296                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 23297                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 23298                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 23299                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 23300                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 23301                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 23302                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 23303                                  ;	conditions:
 23304                                  ;
 23305                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 23306                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 23307                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 23308                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 23309                                  ;
 23310                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 23311                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 23312                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 23313                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 23314                                  ;
 23315                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 23316                                  ;
 23317                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 23318                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 23319                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 23320                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 23321                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 23322                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 23323                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 23324                                  ;	interrupt line.
 23325                                  ;
 23326                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 23327                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 23328                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 23329                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 23330                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 23331                                  ;
 23332                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 23333                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 23334                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 23335                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 23336                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 23337                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 23338                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 23339                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 23340                                  ;
 23341                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 23342                                  
 23343                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23344                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 23345                                  
 23346                                  	; 14/12/2022
 23347                                  stackinit:
 23348 0000126F 50                      	push	ax
 23349 00001270 1E                      	push	ds
 23350 00001271 06                      	push	es
 23351 00001272 53                      	push	bx
 23352 00001273 51                      	push	cx
 23353 00001274 52                      	push	dx
 23354 00001275 57                      	push	di
 23355 00001276 56                      	push	si
 23356 00001277 55                      	push	bp
 23357                                  
 23358                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 23359                                  
 23360                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23361                                  	; ds = cs
 23362 00001278 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 23363 0000127B 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 23364                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 23365                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 23366                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 23367 0000127D 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 23368                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)

 23386

 23407

 23415

 23417

 23425                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space

 24185                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24186                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24187                                  
 24188                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 24189                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 24190                                  
 24191                                  new_init_loop:
 24192                                  
 24193                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 24194                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 24195                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 24196                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 24197                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 24198                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 24199                                  
 24200 00001461 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 24201 00001464 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 24202 00001466 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 24203 0000146A 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 24204                                  
 24205 0000146D 1E                      	push	ds
 24206                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 24207                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 24208                                  	; 21/10/2022
 24209 0000146E B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 24210 00001471 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 24211 00001473 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 24212 00001476 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 24213 00001478 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 24214 0000147C 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 24215 0000147F 1F                      	pop	ds
 24216                                  
 24217 00001480 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 24218 00001483 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 24219 00001487 C3                      	retn
 24220                                  
 24221                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 24222                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24223                                  
 24224                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24225                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 24226                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 24227                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 24228                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 24229                                  ;out: devmark established.
 24230                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 24231                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 24232                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24233                                  
 24234                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 24235                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 24236                                  ; 04/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 24237                                  ; (SYSINIT:176Ch)
 24238                                  
 24239                                  ; 04/09/2023 - PCDOS 7.1 - IBMBIO.COM (SYSINIT:1944h)
 24240                                  
 24241                                  setdevmark:
 24242                                  
 24243                                  	; 04/09/2023
 24244                                  	;push	es
 24245                                  	;push	cx
 24246                                  
 24247 00001488 2E8B0E[6403]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 24248 0000148D 2E890E[AB14]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 24249 00001492 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 24250                                  	; 25/10/2022
 24251                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 24252 00001494 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 24253 00001498 41                      	inc	cx
 24254                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 24255 00001499 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 24256                                  
 24257                                  	; 04/09/2023
 24258                                  	;pop	cx
 24259                                  	;pop	es
 24260                                  	
 24261 0000149E 2EFF06[6403]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 24262 000014A3 C3                      	retn

 24464                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24465                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 24466                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 24467                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 24468                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 24469                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 24470                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 24471                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 24472                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 24473                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 24474                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24475                                  
 24476                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 24477                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 24478 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 24479 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 24480 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 24481                                  endstruc
 24482                                  
 24483                                  _$P_Len_PARMS	   equ	4		;AN000;
 24484                                  _$P_I_Use_Default  equ	0		;AN000; no extra stuff specified
 24485                                  _$P_I_Have_Delim   equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 24486                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 24487                                  
 24488                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24489                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 24490                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 24491                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 24492                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 24493                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 24494                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 24495                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES

 24497                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 24498                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 24499                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24500                                  
 24501                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 24502                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 24503 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 24504 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 24505 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 24506                                  endstruc
 24507                                  
 24508                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24509                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 24510                                  ;
 24511                                  ;
 24512                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 24513                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 24514                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 24515                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 24516                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 24517                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24518                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24519                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24520                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24521                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24522                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24523                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 24524                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 24525                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 24526                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 24527                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 24528                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 24529                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 24530                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 24531                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 24532                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 24533                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 24534                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 24535                                  ;	   :
 24536                                  ;
 24537                                  ;Note:
 24538                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 24539                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 24540                                  ;
 24541                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 24542                                  ;
 24543                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 24544                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 24545                                  ;
 24546                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 24547                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 24548                                  ;
 24549                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 24550                                  ;
 24551                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 24552                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 24553                                  ;
 24554                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 24555                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 24556                                  ;
 24557                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 24558                                  ;
 24559                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 24560                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 24561                                  ;
 24562                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 24563                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 24564                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 24565                                  ;
 24566                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 24567                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 24568                                  ;
 24569                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 24570                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 24571                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 24572                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24573                                  
 24574                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 24575                                  
 24576                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 24577                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 24578                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 24579                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 24580                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 24581                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 24582                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 24583                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 24584                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 24585                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 24586                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 24587                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 24588                                  
 24589                                  ;**** Function flags
 24590                                  
 24591                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 24592                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 24593                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 24594                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 24595                                  
 24596                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 24597                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 24598 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 24599 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 24600 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 24601 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 24602 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 24603 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 24604                                  endstruc
 24605                                  
 24606                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24607                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 24608                                  ;
 24609                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 24610                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 24611                                  ;	     +-
 24612                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 24613                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 24614                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 24615                                  ;	     |	:
 24616                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 24617                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 24618                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 24619                                  ;	     |	:
 24620                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 24621                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 24622                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 24623                                  ;	     +-	:
 24624                                  ;
 24625                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 24626                                  ;
 24627                                  ;Note:
 24628                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 24629                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 24630                                  ;
 24631                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 24632                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 24633                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 24634                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24635                                  
 24636                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 24637                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 24638                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 24639                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 24640                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 24641                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 24642                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 24643                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 24644                                  
 24645                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 24646 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 24647 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 24648 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 24649 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 24650 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 24651                                  endstruc
 24652                                  
 24653                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24654                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 24655                                  ;
 24656                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 24657                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 24658                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 24659                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 24660                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 24661                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 24662                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 24663                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 24664                                  ;
 24665                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 24666                                  ;
 24667                                  ;            +-
 24668                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 24669                                  ;	    | or
 24670                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 24671                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 24672                                  ;	    | or
 24673                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 24674                                  ;	    | or
 24675                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 24676                                  ;	    | or
 24677                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 24678                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 24679                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 24680                                  ;	    | or
 24681                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 24682                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 24683                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 24684                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 24685                                  ;	    +-
 24686                                  ;
 24687                                  ;
 24688                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 24689                                  ;      list.
 24690                                  ;
 24691                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 24692                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 24693                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 24694                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24695                                  
 24696                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 24697                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 24698 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 24699 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 24700 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 24701 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 24702                                  endstruc

 24819                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24820                                  ; SysParse;
 24821                                  ;
 24822                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 24823                                  ;
 24824                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 24825                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 24826                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 24827                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 24828                                  ;
 24829                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 24830                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 24831                                  ;		 is in DS.
 24832                                  ;
 24833                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 24834                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 24835                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 24836                                  ;
 24837                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 24838                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 24839                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 24840                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 24841                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 24842                                  ;
 24843                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 24844                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 24845                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 24846                                  ;
 24847                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 24848                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 24849                                  ;
 24850                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 24851                                  ;
 24852                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 24853                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 24854                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 24855                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 24856                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 24857                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 24858                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 24859                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 24860                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 24861                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 24862                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 24863                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 24864                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 24865                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 24866                                  ;	     (tm08)

 24884

 24886                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 24887                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 24888                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 24889

 24891                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 24892                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 24893                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 24894                                  ;

 24897                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 24898                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 24899                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 24900                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 24901                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 24902                                  
 24903                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 24904                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 24905                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 24906                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 24907                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 24908                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 24909                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 24910                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 24911                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.

 25040                                  ;M029 -- Begin changes
 25041                                  ; The table of special chars _$P_FileSp_Char should be initialized on every
 25042                                  ;entry to SysParse. This is in the non-checksum region and any program that
 25043                                  ;corrupts this table but does not corrupt the checksum region will leave
 25044                                  ;command.com parsing in an inconsistent state.
 25045                                  ; NB: The special characters string has been hardcoded here. If any change
 25046                                  ;is made to it in psdata.inc, a corresponding change needs to be made here.

 25053                                  
 25054                                  	; 06/09/2023
 25055 00001571 C706[4F15]5D5B          	mov	word [_$P_FileSp_Char], ']['

 25517                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 25518                                  ;
 25519                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 25520                                  ;
 25521                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 25522                                  ;	    AL = type
 25523                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 25524                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 25525                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 25526                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 25527                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 25528                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 25529                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 25530                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 25531                                  ;
 25532                                  ; Output:   None
 25533                                  ;
 25534                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 25535                                  ;
 25536                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 25537                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25538

 25933                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25934                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 25935                                  ;
 25936                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 25937                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 25938                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 25939                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 25940                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 25941                                  ;
 25942                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 25943                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 25944                                  ;
 25945                                  ; Output:    None
 25946                                  ;
 25947                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 25948                                  ;
 25949                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 25950                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25951                                  
 25952                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25953                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 25954                                  
 25955                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25956                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C46h)  	
 25957                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 25958 0000191A 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25959 0000191B 2E800E[C114]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 25960 00001921 2E8026[C114]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 25961                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],~_$P_Neg ; 07/07/2023 
 25962 00001927 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 25963 0000192A 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 25964 0000192C 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 25965                                  
 25966 0000192E 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 25967 00001930 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 25968                                  
 25969 00001932 2E800E[C114]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 25970                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 25971 00001938 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 25972                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 25973 00001939 E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 25974 0000193C 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25975 0000193D C3                      	retn
 25976                                  
 25977                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25978                                  
 25979                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)

 26000 00001955 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			;AN000; save binary number

 26002                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26003                                  ; Ref: Disassembled PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM SYSINIT code

 26888                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 26889                                  ;
 26890                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 26891                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 26892                                  ;	    blanks.
 26893                                  ;
 26894                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26895                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 26896                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 26897                                  ;
 26898                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 26899                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 26900                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 26901                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26902                                  
 26903                                  	; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26904                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FAEh
 26905                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2451h) ; (Retro DOS v5.0)
 26906                                  
 26907                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 26908 00001C60 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 26909 00001C61 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26910 00001C62 2EC606[BB14]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 26911                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 26912                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 26913 00001C68 2E8026[C114]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 26914 00001C6E 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 26915 00001C70 7423                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26916                                  
 26917 00001C72 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 26918 00001C74 741F                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26919                                  
 26920 00001C76 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 26921 00001C78 741E                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 26922                                  
 26923                                  ; Note: _$P_Chk_Delim00 part of code is nonsense here
 26924                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 26925                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26926                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 26927                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:246Bh)
 26928                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FC8h)
 26929                                  %if 0
 26930                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26931                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 26932                                  	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 26933                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26934                                  
 26935                                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?

 26937

 26939                                  	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 26940                                  	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 26941                                  	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26942                                  %endif
 26943                                  
 26944                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
