 26947 00001C7F 7214                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26948                                  
 26949                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 26950 00001C81 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 26951                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 26952 00001C83 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 26953                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 26954                                  	;or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 26955                                  	;jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 26956                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26957 00001C87 E30B                    	jcxz	_$P_Chk_Delim_NZ
 26958                                  
 26959 00001C89 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 26960                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 26961 00001C8C 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 26962 00001C8D 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 26963 00001C90 7406                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 26964                                  
 26965 00001C92 E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 26966                                  
 26967                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 26968                                  	;cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 26969                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26970                                  	; cx=0 here
 26971 00001C94 41                      	inc	cx ; cx=1, zf=0
 26972                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 26973                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 26974 00001C95 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26975 00001C96 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 26976 00001C97 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 26977                                  
 26978                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 26979 00001C98 2EA2[BB14]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 26980 00001C9C 2EF606[C114]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 26981 00001CA2 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 26982                                  
 26983 00001CA4 2E800E[C114]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 26984                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 26985                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 26986 00001CAA 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 26987 00001CAC EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26988                                  
 26989                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26990                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 26991                                  ;
 26992                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 26993                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 26994                                  ;
 26995                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26996                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 26997                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 26998                                  ;
 26999                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 27000                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 27001                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 27002                                  
 27003                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 27004                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 27005                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 27006                                  ;
 27007                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 27008                                  
 27009                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 27010                                  ;***********************************************************************
 27011                                  
 27012                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 27013                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 27014                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 27015                                  	; 08/07/2023
 27016 00001CAE BD[CA14]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 27017                                  
 27018                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 27019 00001CB1 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 27020 00001CB3 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 27021                                  
 27022                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 27023 00001CB5 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 27024 00001CB7 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 27025                                  
 27026 00001CB9 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 27027                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 27028                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27029 00001CBA C3                      	retn
 27030                                  
 27031                                  ; 12/12/2022
 27032                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 27033                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 27034                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 27035                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 27036                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 27037                                  
 27038                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 27039                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 27040 00001CBB 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 27041 00001CBD 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 27042                                  
 27043 00001CBF 2E800E[C114]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 27044                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 27045                                  
 27046                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27047                                  	; cf=0
 27048                                  	;retn
 27049                                  
 27050                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 27051                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27052                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 27053 00001CC5 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 27054                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 27055                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 27056 00001CC6 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 27057                                  
 27058                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27059                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 27060                                  ;
 27061                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 27062                                  ;
 27063                                  ;  Input:
 27064                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 27065                                  ;
 27066                                  ;  Output:
 27067                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 27068                                  ;
 27069                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 27070                                  ;
 27071                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 27072                                  ;***************************************************************************
 27073                                  
 27074                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 27075 00001CC7 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 27076 00001CC8 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 27077 00001CC9 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 27078                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 27079                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 27080                                  	; 08/07/2023
 27081 00001CCA 2E8B36[BE14]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 27082 00001CCF 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 27083 00001CD1 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 27084 00001CD3 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 27085 00001CD4 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 27086 00001CD5 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 27087 00001CD6 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 27088 00001CD7 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 27089 00001CD8 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 27090 00001CD9 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 27091                                  	; si = 0 ; 08/07/2023
 27092                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 27093 00001CDA 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 27094 00001CDC B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 27095 00001CDF CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 27096                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 27097 00001CE1 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 27098 00001CE3 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 27099 00001CE5 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 27100 00001CE6 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 27101 00001CE7 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 27102 00001CE8 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 27103 00001CE9 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 27104 00001CEA 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 27105 00001CEB 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 27106 00001CEC 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 27107                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 27108 00001CEE 2E8936[BC14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 27109 00001CF3 2E891E[BE14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 27110                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 27111                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 27112                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 27113                                  	; 08/07/2023
 27114 00001CF8 2EC536[BC14]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 27115                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 27116 00001CFD 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 27117 00001D00 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 27118 00001D02 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 27119 00001D04 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 27120 00001D06 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 27121 00001D09 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 27122 00001D0B F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 27123 00001D0C EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 27124                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 27125 00001D0E 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 27126 00001D0F 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 27127                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 27128 00001D10 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 27129                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 27130                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27131                                  	; cf=0
 27132                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 27133                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 27134 00001D12 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 27135 00001D13 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 27136 00001D14 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 27137 00001D15 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 27699                                  
 27700                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 27701                                  
 27702                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27703                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27704                                  
 27705                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 27706                                  ;
 27707                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 27708                                  ;
 27709                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27710                                  ;
 27711                                  ;   Modification log:
 27712                                  ;
 27713                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 27714                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 27715                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 27716                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 27717                                  ;
 27718                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27719                                  ;
 27720                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 27721                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 27722                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 27723                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 27724                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 27725                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 27726                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 27727                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 27728                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 27729                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 27730                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 27731                                  ;
 27732                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27733                                  
 27734                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 27735                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 27736                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 27737                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 27738                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 27739                                  
 27740                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 27741                                  
 27742                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 27743                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 27744                                  
 27745                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 27746                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 27747                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 27748                                  
 27749                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 27750                                  ;
 27751                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 27752                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 27753                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 27754                                  ;	           line.
 27755                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 27756                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 27757                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 27758                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 27759                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 27760                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 27761                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 27762                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 27763                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 27764                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 27765                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 27766                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 27767                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 27768                                  ;	           for details).
 27769                                  
 27770 00001F15 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 27771 00001F16 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 27772 00001F17 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 27773 00001F19 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 27774 00001F1A 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 27775 00001F2A 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 27776 00001F4A 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 27777 00001F4B 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 27778 00001F4C 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 27779                                  
 27780                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 27781                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 27782                                  
 27783                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 27784                                  
 27785                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27786                                  
 27787                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 27788                                  
 27789                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, SYSCONF.ASM)
 27790                                  ; ((MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS -> SYNINIT:22BAh))
 27791                                  
 27792                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27793                                  ; (SYSINIT:212Bh)	
 27794                                  
 27795                                  		;public	DevEntry
 27796                                  
 27797 00001F4D 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 27798 00001F4F 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 27799 00001F51 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 27800 00001F53 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 27801 00001F57 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 27802                                  ; 30/12/2022
 27803                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 27804 00001F5B 00                      ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 -style) InitDevLoad?
 27805                                  ;
 27806 00001F5C 00                      DevUMB:		db	0	; byte indicating whether to load DDs in UMBs
 27807 00001F5D 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 27808 00001F5F 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)

 27836                                  ; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27837                                  
 27838                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27839                                  ; (SYSINIT:215Eh)
 27840                                  
 27841                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27842                                  ;
 27843                                  ; procedure : doconf
 27844                                  ;
 27845                                  ;             Config file is parsed initially with this routine. For the
 27846                                  ;             Subsequent passes 'multi_pass' entry is used .
 27847                                  ;
 27848                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27849                                  
 27850                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27851                                  doconf:
 27852 00001F81 0E                      	push	cs
 27853 00001F82 1F                      	pop	ds
 27854                                  
 27855 00001F83 B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 27856                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 27857 00001F86 CD21                    	int	21h

 27917                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that

 28076                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28077                                  ;%if 0
 28078                                  
 28079                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 28080                                  
 28081                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 28082                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 28083

 28087                                  
 28088                                  	; 08/09/2023
 28089 00002061 3826[A914]              	cmp	[config_multi],ah ; 0
 28090                                  	;cmp	byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 28091 00002065 7427                            je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 28092                                  
 28093 00002067 50                              push    ax                      ;
 28094 00002068 E8B121                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 28095 0000206B 88C4                            mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 28096 0000206D E8AC21                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 28097 00002070 86C4                            xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 28098 00002072 A3[AF02]                        mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 28099 00002075 58                              pop     ax
 28100                                  ;
 28101                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 28102                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 28103                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 28104                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 28105                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 28106                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 28107                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 28108                                  ;   spot.
 28109                                  ;
 28110                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 28111                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 28112                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 28113                                  ;   retrieved.
 28114                                  ;
 28115 00002076 803E[CD02]02                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 28116 0000207B 7211                            jb	short not_final		; no
 28117                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 28118 0000207D F606[CE02]01            	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 28119 00002082 7407                            jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 28120 00002084 803E[CD02]03                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 28121 00002089 7203                            jb	short not_final		; no
 28122                                  final:                                  ;
 28123 0000208B 268804                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 28124                                  not_final:                              ;
 28125                                  ;endif
 28126                                  
 28127                                  ; 31/12/2022
 28128                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 28129

 28138 0000209C E95408                  	jmp	badop
 28139                                  	
 28140                                  coff:	
 28141                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28142                                  	; ds = cs
 28143                                  	;push	cs
 28144                                  	;pop	ds

 28147                                  
 28148                                  blank_line:

 28150 000020A7 EB9F                    	jmp	short conflp
 28151                                  
 28152                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28153                                  ; 11/12/2022
 28154                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 28155                                  ;coff_p:
 28156                                  	;push	cs
 28157                                  	;pop	ds
 28158                                  
 28159                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 28160                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 28161                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 28162                                  ;install= command.

 28164                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28165                                  ;install command
 28166                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28167                                  
 28168                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 28169                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 28170                                  tryi:
 28171 000020A9 803E[CD02]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 28172 000020AE 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass

 28176                                          ; 11/12/2022

 28178 000020B8 74E5                    	je	short coff

 28180                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff

 28182                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 28183                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 28184                                  					; and before install= commands
 28185                                  					; are processed

 28187 000020BA 803E[CD02]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 28188 000020BF 741D                    	je	short multi_try_i

 28194                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff

 28197                                  ;       but don't process them now.

 28250 000020F0 7537                            jne	short multi_pass_filter	; no. ignore this.
 28251                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 28252 000020F2 E8941F                          call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 28253 000020F5 7232                            jc      short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 28254                                  ;endif
 28255                                  
 28256                                  ;       The memory environment is in its normal DOS state, so do
 28257                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high

 28263

 28265 00002103 B80158                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1 ; 5801h

 28268 00002108 B80258                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h

 28272

 28292                                  multi_pass_filter:
 28293 00002129 80FC59                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_COMMENT ; 'Y' ; comment?

 28299                                  
 28300                                  multi_pass_adjust:			; these commands need to
 28301 00002138 FF0E[5A03]              	dec	word [chrptr]		;  adjust chrptr,count
 28302 0000213C FF06[5603]              	inc	word [count]		;  for newline proc.

 28311                                  ; buffer command
 28312                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28313                                  
 28314                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28315                                  ;									      *
 28316                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *

 30049                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30050                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 30051                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 30052                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 30053                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 30054                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 30055                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 30056                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 30057                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30058                                  
 30059                                  ;**************************************************************************
 30060                                  ;									  *
 30061                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 30062                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 30063                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 30064                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 30065                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 30066                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 30067                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 30068                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 30069                                  ; input :								  *
 30070                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 30071                                  ; output:								  *
 30072                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 30073                                  ;									  *
 30074                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 30075                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 30076                                  ; logic:								  *
 30077                                  ; {									  *
 30078                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 30079                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 30080                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 30081                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 30082                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 30083                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 30084                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 30085                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 30086                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 30087                                  ;	     }								  *
 30088                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 30089                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 30090                                  ;	};								  *
 30091                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 30092                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 30093                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 30094                                  ; };									  *
 30095                                  ;**************************************************************************

 30845                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 30850                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 30851                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 30852                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 30853                                  ;	*** after each call.
 30854                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 30855                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 30856                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 30857                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 30858                                  ;	 procedure.

 31208                                  ;
 31209                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 31210                                  ;
 31211                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 31212                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 31213                                  ;
 31214                                  ;	Output : none
 31215                                  ;
 31216                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 31217                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 31218                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 31219                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 31220                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 31221                                  ;
 31222                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31223                                  
 31224                                  LieInt12Mem:
 31225                                  	; 11/12/2022
 31226                                  	; ds = cs
 31227 00002979 A1[A502]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 31228                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12 as alloclim
 31229                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 31230 0000297C E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 31231 0000297F 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 31232                                  	; 13/05/2019
 31233                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 31234                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 31235                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 31236                                  	; 11/12/2022
 31237                                  	; ds = cs
 31238 00002981 803E[6B1F]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 31239 00002986 74F0                    	je	short limx
 31240 00002988 A1[511F]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 31241                                  lim_set:
 31242                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 31243                                  	; 11/12/2022
 31244                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 31245                                  ;limx:
 31246                                  	;retn
 31247                                  	
 31248                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 31249                                  
 31250                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31251                                  ;
 31252                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 31253                                  ;
 31254                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 31255                                  ;	Output : none
 31256                                  ;
 31257                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 31258                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 31259                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 31260                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 31261                                  ;
 31262                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31263                                  
 31264                                  	; 01/11/2022
 31265                                  SetInt12Mem:
 31266 0000298B 1E                      	push	ds
 31267 0000298C BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 31268 0000298F 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 31269 00002991 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 31270 00002995 2E891E[6F1F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 31271 0000299A B106                    	mov	cl,6
 31272 0000299C D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 31273 0000299E A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 31274 000029A1 2EC606[6E1F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 31275 000029A7 1F                      	pop	ds
 31276                                  ;limx:
 31277 000029A8 C3                      	retn
 31278                                  
 31279                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31280                                  ;
 31281                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 31282                                  ;
 31283                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 31284                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 31285                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 31286                                  ;
 31287                                  ;	Output : none
 31288                                  ;
 31289                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 31290                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 31291                                  ;
 31292                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31293                                  
 31294                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 31295                                  	; 11/12/2022
 31296                                  	; ds = cs
 31297 000029A9 803E[6E1F]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 31298                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 31299                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 31300                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 31301 000029AE 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 31302                                  	; 18/12/2022
 31303 000029B0 B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 31304 000029B3 8826[6E1F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 31305                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 31306                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 31307 000029B7 1E                      	push	ds
 31308                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 31309 000029B8 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 31310 000029BA 2EA1[6F1F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 31311 000029BE A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 31312 000029C1 1F                      	pop	ds
 31313                                  timx:
 31314 000029C2 C3                      	retn
 31315

 31364                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 31365                                  ;%if 0
 31366                                  
 31367                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31368                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 31369                                  
 31370                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 31371                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 31372                                  
 31373                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 31374                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 31375                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 31376                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31377                                  
 31378                                  ;******************************************************************************
 31379                                  ;
 31380                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 31381                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 31382                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 31383                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 31384                                  ;
 31385                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 31386                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 31387                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 31388                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 31389                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 31390                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 31391                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 31392                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 31393                                  ; available during the load.
 31394                                  ;
 31395                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 31396                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 31397                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 31398                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 31399                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 31400                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 31401                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 31402                                  ;
 31403                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 31404                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 31405                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 31406                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 31407                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 31408                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 31409                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 31410                                  ;
 31411                                  ;******************************************************************************
 31412                                  
 31413                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 31414                                  
 31415                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 31416                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 31417                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 31418                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 31419                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 31420                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 31421                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 31422                                  
 31423                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 31424                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 31425                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 31426                                  
 31427                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31428                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 31429                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31430                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 31431                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 31432                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 31433                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31434                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31435                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 31436                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 31437                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31438                                  
 31439                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31440                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 31441                                  
 31442                                  InitVar:
 31443                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31444                                  	; ds = cs
 31445                                  
 31446                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 31447                                  	; 03/01/2023
 31448                                  	;push	ax
 31449                                  	;push	cx
 31450                                  	;push	di
 31451 000029ED 06                      	push	es
 31452                                  
 31453                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 31454 000029EE 0E                      	push	cs
 31455 000029EF 07                      	pop	es
 31456                                  
 31457 000029F0 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 31458                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 31459                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 31460                                  	;mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 31461                                  	;mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 31462                                  	;				;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 31463                                  	;mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 31464                                  
 31465                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31466                                  	; ds = cs
 31467 000029F2 A2[161F]                	mov	[fUmbTiny],al		;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 31468 000029F5 A2[151F]                	mov	[fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 31469 000029F8 A3[171F]                	mov	[SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 31470 000029FB C606[191F]FF            	mov	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 31471                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 31472 00002A00 A2[4C1F]                	mov	[fm_argc], al		;Start with zero args having been read
 31473                                  
 31474 00002A03 FC                      	cld
 31475                                  
 31476 00002A04 B91000                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 31477 00002A07 BF[1A1F]                	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 31478 00002A0A F3AA                    	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 31479                                  
 31480                                  	;mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 31481                                  	; 01/01/2033
 31482 00002A0C B110                    	mov	cl,MAXUMB ; 16
 31483 00002A0E BF[2A1F]                	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 31484 00002A11 F3AB                    	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 31485                                  
 31486                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 31487                                  
 31488                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 31489 00002A13 07                      	pop	es
 31490                                  	; 03/01/2023
 31491                                  	;pop	di
 31492                                  	;pop	cx
 31493                                  	;pop	ax	 	
 31494                                  
 31495 00002A14 C3                      	retn
 31496                                  
 31497                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31498                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 31499                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31500                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 31501                                  ; EXIT    : None
 31502                                  ; ERROR   : None
 31503                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 31504                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31505                                  
 31506                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31507                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 31508                                  FixMem:
 31509                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31510                                  	;push	ax
 31511                                  	;push	bx
 31512                                  	;push	cx
 31513                                  	;push	dx
 31514 00002A15 06                      	push	es
 31515                                  
 31516 00002A16 E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 31517                                  
 31518 00002A19 E80002                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 31519 00002A1C 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 31520                                  
 31521 00002A1E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 31522                                  
 31523                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 31524                                  
 31525 00002A20 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 31526 00002A22 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 31527 00002A24 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 31528                                  
 31529                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31530                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 31531                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 31532                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31533                                  
 31534 00002A25 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 31535 00002A29 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 31536 00002A2E 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 31537 00002A30 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 31538                                  
 31539                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 31540                                  
 31541 00002A32 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 31542 00002A37 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 31543 00002A39 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 31544                                  
 31545 00002A3D 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 31546                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 31547                                  	; 11/07/2023
 31548 00002A42 43                      	inc	bx
 31549 00002A43 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 31550                                  
 31551                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 31552                                  
 31553 00002A48 8CC1                    fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 31554 00002A4A 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 31555                                  
 31556 00002A4F 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 31557 00002A51 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31558 00002A56 43                      	inc	bx
 31559 00002A57 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 31560                                  
 31561                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 31562 00002A59 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 31563 00002A5B 75C8                    	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 31564                                  fmX:	
 31565 00002A5D E81300                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 31566                                  
 31567 00002A60 07                      	pop	es
 31568                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31569                                  	;pop	dx
 31570                                  	;pop	cx
 31571                                  	;pop	bx
 31572                                  	;pop	ax
 31573                                  
 31574 00002A61 C3                      	retn
 31575                                  
 31576                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31577                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 31578                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31579                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 31580                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 31581                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31582                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 31583                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31584                                  
 31585                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31586                                  fm_link:
 31587 00002A62 B80258                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 31588 00002A65 CD21                    	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 31589                                  
 31590                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 31591                                  	;
 31592                                  	;push	es
 31593                                  	;push	cs
 31594                                  	;pop	es
 31595                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 31596                                  	;pop	es
 31597                                  	
 31598                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31599                                  	; ds = cs
 31600                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 31601 00002A67 A2[4A1F]                	mov	[fm_umb],al
 31602                                  
 31603 00002A6A B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 31604 00002A6D BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 31605 00002A70 CD21                    	int	21h
 31606 00002A72 C3                      	retn
 31607                                  
 31608                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31609                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 31610                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31611                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 31612                                  ; EXIT:     None
 31613                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31614                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 31615                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31616                                  
 31617                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31618                                  fm_unlink:
 31619 00002A73 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 31620                                  	
 31621                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 31622                                  	;
 31623                                  	;push	ds
 31624                                  	;push	cs
 31625                                  	;pop	ds
 31626                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 31627                                  	;pop	ds
 31628                                  	
 31629                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31630                                  	; ds = cs
 31631                                  	;mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 31632 00002A75 8A1E[4A1F]              	mov	bl,[fm_umb]
 31633                                  
 31634 00002A79 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 31635 00002A7C CD21                    	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 31636 00002A7E C3                      	retn
 31637                                  
 31638                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31639                                  
 31640                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31641                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 31642                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 31643                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31644                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 31645                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 31646                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 31647                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31648                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31649                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 31650                                  ;
 31651                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 31652                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 31653                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 31654                                  ;
 31655                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 31656                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 31657                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 31658                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 31659                                  ;
 31660                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 31661                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 31662                                  ;
 31663                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31664                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 31665                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 31666                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 31667                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 31668                                  ;     lh
 31669                                  ;     /l
 31670                                  ;     1
 31671                                  ;     1000
 31672                                  ;     2
 31673                                  ;     print
 31674                                  ;     /d
 31675                                  ;     :lpt2
 31676                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 31677                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 31678                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 31679                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 31680                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 31681                                  ; for:
 31682                                  ;    Each /L
 31683                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 31684                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 31685                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 31686                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 31687                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 31688                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31689                                  
 31690                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31691                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 31692                                  
 31693                                  ParseVar:
 31694                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 31695                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31696                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 31697 00002A7F 1E                      	push	ds
 31698 00002A80 06                      	push	es
 31699                                  
 31700 00002A81 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 31701 00002A82 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 31702 00002A83 FC                      	cld
 31703                                  
 31704                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31705                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 31706                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31707                                  
 31708 00002A84 AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 31709 00002A85 E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 31710 00002A88 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 31711                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31712 00002A8A 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 31713 00002A8C 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 31714                                  
 31715 00002A8E 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 31716 00002A8F F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 31717 00002A90 EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 31718                                  
 31719 00002A92 AC                      pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 31720                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 31721 00002A93 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 31722                                  	;cmp	al,'S'

 31766                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31767                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 31768                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31769                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 31770                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 31771                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 31772                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 31773                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31774                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 31775                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 31776                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 31777                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 31778                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31779                                  
 31780                                  parseL:
 31781 00002AC0 AC                      	lodsb
 31782 00002AC1 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 31783 00002AC3 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 31784                                  
 31785                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31786                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 31787                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31788                                  
 31789 00002AC5 E8DB00                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 31790 00002AC8 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 31791 00002ACA E89D01                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 31792                                  
 31793 00002ACD 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 31794 00002ACF E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 31795 00002AD2 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 31796                                  
 31797                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 31798 00002AD4 2EFE06[4C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31799                                  
 31800 00002AD9 AC                      	lodsb
 31801 00002ADA 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 31802 00002ADC 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 31803                                  
 31804 00002ADE E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 31805 00002AE1 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 31806                                  
 31807 00002AE3 E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 31808 00002AE6 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 31809                                  
 31810                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31811 00002AE8 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 31812 00002AEA 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 31813                                  
 31814 00002AEC 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 31815 00002AEE 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 31816                                  
 31817                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 31818                                  
 31819 00002AF0 E8B000                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 31820 00002AF3 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 31821                                  
 31822 00002AF5 E81601                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 31823                                  
 31824 00002AF8 E8CE01                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 31825                                  
 31826                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 31827 00002AFB 2EFE06[4C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31828                                  
 31829 00002B00 AC                      	lodsb
 31830 00002B01 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 31831 00002B03 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 31832                                  
 31833 00002B05 E82200                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 31834 00002B08 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 31835                                  
 31836 00002B0A E81200                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 31837 00002B0D 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 31838                                  
 31839                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31840 00002B0F 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 31841 00002B11 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 31842                                  plE1:	
 31843                                  	;mov	ax,1
 31844 00002B13 B80100                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 31845 00002B16 4E                      	dec	si

 31888                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31889                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31890                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31891                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31892                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31893                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31894                                  ; USES:     ZF
 31895                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31896                                  
 31897                                  isEOL:
 31898 00002B1F 3C00                    	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 31899 00002B21 7406                    	je	short ieX
 31900 00002B23 3C0D                    	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 31901 00002B25 7402                    	je	short ieX
 31902 00002B27 3C0A                    	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 31903                                  ieX:	
 31904 00002B29 C3                      	retn

 31906                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 31908                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31909                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31910                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 31911                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31912                                  ; USES:     ZF

 31915                                  isWhite:
